snippet.title: PNG track queen in good shape ahead of World Championships
snippet.content: The fastest woman in the Pacific, Papua New Guinea's Toea Wisil, heads the islands contingent competing in the World Athletics Championships in London, which open this weekend. The double Oceania and Australian champion will be racing in both the 100 metres and 200 metres events, and will be keen to improve on her performance at the Rio Olympics last year, when things didn't quite go to plan. Toea Wisil carries the region's best hopes of making an impact on the world stage, and her coach, Tony Fairweather, says the signs are positive.
